content.title: Anomalous First Rib
content.description: Congenital abnormality of the first rib that may contribute to thoracic outlet syndrome.

clinical_features.mechanism: Altered anatomy narrows thoracic outlet space

tos_association.contribution: May cause or exacerbate TOS symptoms
tos_association.diagnosis: Plain radiograph or CT identifies anomaly

treatment.surgical: First rib resection including anomalous segment
treatment.approach: Transaxillary or supraclavicular depending on anatomy

content.clinical_pearl: Always obtain plain films in TOS evaluation to identify rib anomalies that alter surgical planning
content.statement: Anomalous First Rib is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Anomalous First Rib helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Anomalous First Rib include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Anomalous First Rib.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Anomalous First Rib. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
